alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Sharp (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:48AM CDT until March 27 at 1:56AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Spring River At Hardy affecting Fulton and Sharp Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Spring River At Hardy. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Serious flooding in Fulton and Sharp counties along the river. Dangerous situation with swift water running through campground and under homes along the river. September 2006 flood crested at 16.8 feet. Life threatening situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 15.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Spring River Hardy 10.0 4.4 Fri 10 AM 12.7 6.4 5.3 15.5 7 AM 3/25 &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
